publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: The battaile of Agincourt : Fought by Henry the fift of that name, King of England, against the whole power of the French: vnder the raigne of their Charles the sixt, anno Dom. 1415. The miseries of Queene Margarite, the infortunate wife, of that most infortunate King Henry the sixt. Nimphidia, the court of Fayrie. The quest of Cinthia. The shepheards Sirena. The moone-calfe. Elegies vpon sundry occasions. By Michaell Drayton, Esquire
monogr.author: Drayton, Michael

div.p:
TO you those Noblest of Gentlemen of these Renowned Kingdomes of Great Britaine: who in these declining times, haue yet in your braue bosomes the sparkes of that sprightly fire, of your couragious Ancestors; and to this houre retaine the seedes of their magnanimitie and Greatnesse, who out of the vertue of your mindes, loue and cherish neglected Poesie, the delight of
Blessed soules, And the language of Angels. To you are these my Poems dedicated.

closer.signed: By your truely affectioned Seruant, MICHAELL DRAYTON.
